Profile.Comment: I started programming and mechanical engineering studies at the same time. During my career, I have been always developing scientific codes and engineering software for various clients. My AI experience is not limited to ML only and I have extensive experience with optimization, and data collection/acquisition as well. In addition, I worked on pure software engineering projects like web design and CMS, shop sale management system with MYSQL database as well.
Profile.Profile: I am a mechanical engineer and developer. I started programing and mechanical studies at the same time and during my carrier, I always dealt with projects which where a combination of MATH, Engineering and Programing. I have worked as full time, part time, contractor, and freelancer. Recently I am focusing on AI and data engineering with big data tools as developer and CAE/CAD as mechanical engineer. I will accept new learning opportunities in both mentioned fields (full time, contract). If the project seems fascinating, I will accept freelance and part time positions as well if offered.

Education.Comment:
The major focus of my study was to develop an optimization framework with proper data post processing and presentation for multidisciplinary decision making.
The project included developing numerical simulation algorithm,  programing, optimization data processing, data reduction with non-dimensional paramteres, and regressions.
Education.Thesis: Developing an exergo-economic optimization framework for biogas-fed gas trubines.

Education.Comment: I attended technical courses during thestudy was including Gas Turbines, Steam Trubines, Pumps fans couplings(hydrolic),Boilers Desing, Condensors Desing, Industrial Control, Industrial Control Elements (Lab), Powerplant Operation and Monitoring, Electrical Motors in addition to the main stream mechanical courses.
Education.Thesis: Investigating the flow revesal in the boiler gas recirculation fan of Hamadan powerplant.
Education.Institue: Shahid Beheshti Univeristy-Engineering Campus-(formerly known as Univeristy of Water and Power Technology)

Achievements: ML models with above 70% accuracies in long performance test
Model speed improvements by up to 800% which were suitable for predictive control system
Semi reinforced learning model for building with ability to improve accuracy over time by 10%

Projects.Comment: A unique robot application required a 2D planar optimal routing.  The robot was used to perform a certain task for multiple objects in a deterministic location (known prior to route planning but changed on daily basis). Hence an optimal path routing to minimize the time of operation and distance traveled was required. Since it was a multi objective optimization of a nonlinear nature, an NSGAIII solver was developed for fully integer problem with improved speed to find the optimal sequence. The robot movement model was obtained through testing using a regression model (black box) to achieve fast optimization.
Projects.Title: Developing a program for optimal robot routing (2D plan) to minimize time and travel distance

Projects.Comment:
A software was developed for transient thermal response simulation of a thermal photovoltaic system. The program was developed in three stages:
1-	A MATLAB code package
2-	A Java software which runs in multi-thread application coupled with Monte Carlo simulation method for large random input sets to perform statistical model analysis. 
3-	A machine learning regression model is obtained from the previous section for performance evaluation.
Projects.Title: Software development for Solar TPV simulation and statistical performance modeling using ML.

Projects.Comment: Statistical methods are applied to control industrial processes (control charts). When the chart shows an out-of-control condition, it is required to assess the possible cause. A classification ML was applied on the process data to automatically detect possible cause of issue using a combination of logic, simulation data and experimentally available data for training the model. Then the model is tested, and the app was developed that accepts the raw data and detect the possible cause (ranked causes by probabilities).
Projects.Title: Developing an application for industrial process control using AI for cause detection.

Projects.Comment: A dataset used to train a pretrained ALEXNET. The input data were raw images and data engineering was required prior to training or feeding to the trained model for diagnostic.  A range of Image processing techniques were applied including edge and area detection, shape analysis, and cropping to divide a single image of cells groups into small photos of individual cells. Then all the individual images were fed to the developed model and the outcome was used to diagnose the category of issues along with percentages of each case occurrence.
Projects.Title: ALEXNET + Image Processing for Blood cell sickness diagnostic (a code package with UI)

Projects.Comment: A building developer company was applying smart energy management methods for a set of residential buildings. A large network of sensors was installed for a residential complex to monitor variety of daily energy usages. The target was to develop a statistical-physical model (physical-ML model) for building energy consumption prediction, using sensor data. The data was labeled and stored in a SQL database by data acquisition software. The model was adaptive and automatically retrained as more data were gathered.
Projects.Title: Developing a mix statistical-physical models for building energy performance estimation using machine learning and sensor data.

Projects.Comment:
CFD models while accurate and detailed, are resource extensive and timely. A shape optimization study required a unique program to be developed. CFD model was carried out with ANSYS FLUENT, but the output was given to a developed surrogate model (kriging or ML based) to correlate the data with the performance outputs. The model then coupled with a GA global minimizer. The program concept was to simultaneously converge the optimizer-surrogate model to an optimal design point by adding each optimization point as a new solution to surrogate model and retraining the model. Two criteria were chosen as measuring the convergence:
�	ML model or kriging interpolator error for newly add CFD values. 
�	Convergence of best solution values of GA optimizer.
Projects.Title: Developing a coupled surrogate-optimizer program for CFD-shape optimization.

Responsibilities: Developing required mathematical models
Developing required algorithms or adopt and modify the existing algorithms
Applying suitable methods to capture optimal paths from 2D photos for robot routing
Create necessary data processing algorithm and programs for raw data processing and pipelining
Developing user interfaces with data visualization and reporting capabilities
Statistical analysis of data, dimension reduction, cleaning, and preparation (structuring) for model extraction
Applying suitable machine learning methods and extract the models
Validation and verification (with test design if required)
Combine all processes into an application with user friendly procedure

Achievements: Accurate and verified simulations
Design optimization to reduce system mass by 15%
Design automation applications which reduce the design time by 80%

Projects.Comment:
A complete analysis of an existing air compressor (reciprocator) was requested in this project. The requirement was: 
To develop a program that simulate the transient thermofluidic performance of reciprocator. 
To create a detailed 3D model of the compressor. (Cylinder section with cooling)
To conduct structural analysis under operating condition (variable load). (Cylinder section) 
To perform transient thermal simulation to estimate cooling fins performance.
Projects.Title: 3D modeling, structural analysis, and thermal simulation of a reciprocating air compressor in SOLIDWORKS

Projects.Comment:
A robot arm with five degrees of freedom was modeled in SOLIDWORKS and motion analysis was conducted to understand the robot movement with given path plan. Kinematic and dynamic analysis were also conducted to realize the forces and torque required by motor and actuators in addition to structural integrity analysis (FEA) for critical parts. Finally, some design improvements were suggested as well. 
The project included three sections: kinematic and dynamic analysis, 3D modeling and motion analysis.
Projects.Title: 3D Modeling and motion analysis of a robotic arm. (SOLIDWORKS)

Projects.Comment: A gear design application for specific custom gear type was developed that followed the standard gear design methods. The output of design was a detailed 3D model.
Projects.Title: Developing a gear design application in (INVENTOR, SOLIDWORK).

Projects.Comment: A manufacturer was creating frame and structure in standard and common form with standard components. Hence, the procedure was highly suitable for automation. An ILOGIC application developed with UI in inventor to automate the design procedure based on the customer need and available elements and parts stock.
Projects.Title: Developing a design automation application using INVENTOR ILOGIC (frame and structure production)

Projects.Comment:
For multiple clients, I performed visualization tasks and animation creation in SOLIDWORKS visualize. The example of my works where includes:
Headset: Animation with no motion analysis but high-end photo renders.
A mechanism solution: motion analysis, animation of motion analysis result with visualize.
A robot arm: animation of a robotic arm in action for advertising. 
A process line including conveyor: for concept visualization and advertisement.
Projects.Title: Product modeling and visualization. Photo realistic rendering and animation using SOLIDWORKS visualize.

Projects.Comment: A powder storage silo was required for a manufacturing facility. A standard design approach was conducted for the design of the storage silo. Since the storage was installed on a structure with rotary machines, a structural and modal analysis was also required. To perform the task, after design the silo, a complete 3D model in AUTODESK INVENTOR was created and structural and modal analysis were performed. Finally design changes and adequate structural supports and vibrational dampers were considered to ensure the operation safety.
Projects.Title: Design of powder storage silo with structural and dynamic modal analysis.

Responsibilities: Developing necessary mathematical models (especially for robot dynamics)
Creating 3D models in software
Conducting structural, thermal, motion and modal analysis as required in SOLIDWORKS
Verification and validation of analysis results
Developing the iLOGIC app in Inventor
Developing applications using 3D software APIs in (VBA)
Photo and animation rendering in SOLIDWORK Visualize

Achievements: An easy-to-use application with proper documentation.
Extendable and flexible code structure for future development.
Acceptable level of accuracy which matches with client requirements.
The concept of "Software as knowledge management system" was achieved.

Projects.Comment: A fluid charging system was developed by a company for various customer�s needs. The company requested to integrate all their design process into a single application. The project was involved: the app UI development, solver development for different sections, and integrate the already developed solvers in FORTRAN and C++ by design department.
Projects.Title: Developing an application for fluid charging process design

Projects.Comment: A program was developed to analyses the performance of a fluidic system using the sensor data. The program read the sensor data and converted them to understandable performance values for process designers. In addition, a program was developed to analysis the possibility of a certain cause if an abrupt performance drop was happened. To realize if the incident (cause) happened a gray box model (a data driven model that satisfies the thermodynamics and fluid dynamics laws) was required.  The result of the model was to confirm if the certain cause was behind the performance abrupt change.
Projects.Title: Developing program for fluid system analysis and fault detection using sensors data

Projects.Comment:
An automated test was designed for a biofluidic material. A biofluid samples where stored in glass test tubes. Then an image was taking by a camera setup. The goal of this project was to develop a program that runs on a device and evaluate the level of stratified biofluid and shows the volumetric ratio of each layer of fluid. 
First step was to provide recommendation for proper camera setup and lighting. Afterward a program developed that takes raw images and convert them to color-height maps for three channels and using a unique fast mathematical algorithm developed for this application, height of each section was calculated and converted to the volumetric ratios. The code has been developed in C++ languages with bare minimal dependencies and resource usage to run on a device, hence developing a unique algorithm was required.
Projects.Title: Developing a program for level measurement of biofluidic material in a tube using image processing

Projects.Comment:
Magnetic refrigeration uses magnetocaloric effect to cool down a working fluid. The developed application was capable of a transient one-dimensional magneto refrigerator pack. The output of analysis was transient temperature distribution across time-length of the bed, storage requirement and temperature change of storage, required fluid pumping power and power required for magnetic field maintenance (variation). As requested, the solver was developed in C++ as DLLs and UI in C#. Finite volume method was used for discretization.  
That application was a design and analysis package which were capable of:
�	Analyzing multi material (serial) bed configuration. (Configuration and materials as input)
�	Define and use various materials as libraries for magnetic material and working fluid.
�	Working with a custom magnetic cycle function.
Projects.Title: Developing Transient Magneto-Refrigerator simulation program

Projects.Comment:
A mixed multi scale (time-space) model was developed for a borehole system. A borehole is a geothermal energy system which uses a ground (soil) as storage medium. In this work, a program has developed that modeled the whole borehole-ground system from fluid input to the bores till fluid output from the bores. Transient performance over the years of operation, ground temperature distribution and required pumping power was all the output for a given network of bores. Boreholes geometry and locations was given as an input to a numerical solver. As different time and space scales appeared in the problem FD solver was used for the ground and a 4th order Runge-Kutta was used for the borehole fluid model. The interface between two domains-models was developed using interpolating functions. 
As the main topic was proposing an accurate time dependent predictive function for control purpose, a physically driven mathematical equation form was developed mathematically. Later, the proposed model constant was fitted to a set of randomly generated inputs and outputs from the simulator mentioned above.
To match the data with each real cases, a tuning term was added with constants driven from the experimental test data (setup test).
Projects.Title: Developing transient modeling program for Borehole Thermal energy storage

Responsibilities: Develop the mathematical model
Discretization and numerical algorithm
Programming the core solver and user interface
Testing and verification of final application (including test design)

Achievements: Verified and accurate performance modeling and energy demand estimation
Providing optimization suggestion which reduces 5% energy demand reduction in building.
Solar plant optimal design for maximum profit.
A 95% reliability for off grid solar powered building in spring summer with 99% mixed energy system reliability overall.

Projects.Comment: To develop a proper business plan and assess accurate cost benefit analysis prior to any further step is required. In the project, a detailed cost analysis for a 5MW solar powerplant was conducted according to the customer available financial scenarios with government intensives for renewable power generation and buyback programs. As renewable energy output is highly variable, it was necessary to evaluate accurate production outputs. Then a post processing program is developed to match outputs and elements costs with local government policies, grid electricity market and customer financial capabilities and options. Finally, a detailed cost of electricity analysis with estimated annual income for different scenarios were prepared and a decision table was provided.
Projects.Title: Feasibility study of a 5MW solar powerplant using System Advisory Model (SAM).

Projects.Comment:
An architectural design of an educational facility with about 10000 square meters floor area in AutoCAD files was provided by the client to assess the detailed hourly demand of heat cooling and electricity. The detailed hourly data was required for a smart renewable building design. To achieve the goal, a building 3D model was created in SKETCHUP and ENERGYPLUS SKETCHUP plugin was used to model the energy consumption by given:
�	Building Schedules. 
�	Building Occupancy estimation (provide by client).
�	Building spaces applications, and list of appliances (including laboratories, workshops). 
�	Assumptions on the occasional usage of leisure, theater, and conference area. 
The target was to determine the hourly energy demand to ensure:
�	National Standards (Highest priority)
�	ASHREA Standards (Second Highest) 
�	Equipment safety and O&M requirements if applicable.
The verification was required. For verification, calculations were verified by:
�	A model building which was under the test.
�	Comparing results with national standards calculations for the same building (average daily).
Projects.Title: Building energy demand estimation using Sketchup + Energy Plus.

Projects.Comment:
An off grid seasonal mansion was relying on conventional diesel generators. As the mansion was luxurious the client was looking for a safe (there were dangers regarding large flammable fuel storage), quiet (considering the noise of generator) yet reliable solar system for the building. The target of the project was to design a PV system which supplies electricity demand of building in two main operation mode:
1-	High demand period: Three month of summer with high sun availability.
2-	Low demand period: The rest of the year to keep the basic maintenance of building running.
In addition, there where critical level of demand for security system that must be always met.
The optimal sizing of the PV system with battery banks was conducted using SAM software for the local sun condition. A risk assessment was conducted also for critical demand to ensure the safety and security system operation. 
Comprehensive statistical methods were used to ensure the reliability since the building was off grid.
Projects.Title: Residential PV design and analysis using System Advisory Model (SAM).

Responsibilities: Performance analysis using EnergyPlus and SketchUP
Performance analysis using SAM
Economic assessment
Feasibility analysis

Achievements: Client satisfaction for quality service.

Projects.Title: Cost estimation for SANGAN Iron Ore plant

Projects.Comment: The project required a pure C-C++ implementation of the program, and no Arduino API was allowed. The datasheet of the board was provided and completely examined to understand the board logic and structure required for programing. In addition, some hardware components were equipped with chips with different clock time and a careful timing for communication were required. A combination of digital and analogue pins, interrupts and serial ports were used in the project.
Projects.Title: programing Arduino board with multiple sensor actuators in pure C-C++ (without Arduino libraries)

Projects.Comment: A robotic project was consisting of multiple motors, sensors and actuators which required multiple boards to be used at the same time. Hence a master board were taking care of the main operation logic while other boards control certain sensors and motors for fast and secure operations.
Projects.Title: Developing the master controller board logic (program) for a multi Arduino board control system
